directions: In a large skillet over medium heat, saut√© the asparagus in one teaspoon oil, stirring occasionally, for about four minutes, until bright green. Add garlic, lemon zest, and red pepper flakes and cook for one minute more. Turn off heat and finish with a squeeze of juice from half the lemon, and salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
Make the dressing by whisking together the Balsamic vinegar with the shallot. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil and whisk vigorously until emulsified. Add salt and pepper to taste.
In a large salad bowl, toss the lettuces with the dressing. Top with the asparagus, feta and finish with slices of white peach. Best served immediately.
ingredients: 1 small bunch asparagus, sliced on the bias
Zest of one lemon, reserve 1/2 lemon for juice
5-6 cups mixed greens, such as lettuces, young kale, arugula
Sea salt and pepper to taste
title: SALAD OF WHITE PEACHES AND ASPARAGUS
